thread.title: Laporte man injured in single-vehicle crash
thread.title_full: Laporte man injured in single-vehicle crash

author: Staff reports
title: Laporte man injured in single-vehicle crash
text:
Laporte man injured in single-vehicle crash
Rolf Smeby, 79, of Laporte was transported to Sanford Bemidji Medical Center with non-life threatening injuries on April 8.
A driver from Laporte sustained injuries in a single-vehicle crash Tuesday, April 8 in Steamboat River Township.
According to a Minnesota State Patrol incident report, the crash was reported at about 12:56 p.m. at the intersection of County 39 and Parkway Forest Road.
ADVERTISEMENT
A 2006 Subaru Forester, driven by Rolf Smeby, 79, of Laporte, was traveling west on County 39 when it left the roadway and hit an approach, causing it to go airborne, the report states.
Smeby was transported by ambulance to Sanford Bemidji Medical Center with non-life threatening injuries, according to the report.
Road conditions were dry and alcohol was not involved in the crash, the report says. Air bags did not deploy, and it is unknown whether Smeby was wearing a seat belt, the report states
ADVERTISEMENT
